conclusion: Determine the longest propagation time of refracted light within the hemisphere.
Triangle ABC has vertices A, B, and C, with side BC parallel to the incident light.
Light is incident on side AB, and only light entering through segment BD can enter the hemisphere.
Length of BD is given as L/4.
Hemisphere is positioned with its flat side along BC, and its center is point O on BC.
Radius of the hemisphere is L/2 because the diameter BC is equal to L.
Light enters the hemisphere through point D.
Find the longest path light can take within the hemisphere before it exits.
Longest path light can take inside the hemisphere is along the diameter.
Since light enters at point D, the longest path would be from D to the opposite point on the hemisphere's boundary, passing through the center O.
Longest path is the diameter of the hemisphere, which is L.
Speed of light in vacuum is c.
Time taken for light to travel the longest path (diameter) inside the hemisphere is L/c.
Longest propagation time of the refracted light in the hemisphere is L/c.
